div.head: A Pillar of Salt to Seaſon a corrupt Age.
div.p: OUR Bleſſed SAVIOUR ſpeaking to his Diſciples of the calamitous Deſtruction which ſhou'd be brought on Jeruſalem, warn'd them to flee out of it, when they ſhou'd ſee the Abomination of Deſolation ſtanding in the holy Place: i. e. The Roman Army beſieging the City. In the verſe immediately preceding our Text he ſaid, In that day, he which ſhall be in the houſe-top, and his ſtaff in the houſe, let him not come down to take it away: and he that is in the field, let him likewiſe not turn back: As if he had ſaid, Let every one of my Servants make all poſſible haſte to get out of Jeruſalem, when the Judgments of GOD ſhall be irreſiſtibly breaking in upon it. And to preſs this Advice, and excite them to flee with the greateſt ſpeed, He added theſe words, Remember Lot's Wife. — And what he ſaid to them, he now ſaith to us all, whom he is warning to flee from Wrath, Remember Lot's Wife. We ſhould remember her, not for our Imitation, but for our Admonition and Awakning. — We ſhould remember her Sin, and her Puniſhment, and may receive much Inſtruction and ſpiritual Profit therefrom.
I. WE ſhou'd remember the SIN of Lot's Wife.

THIS is recorded, Gen. 19.26. His Wife looked back from behind him. In her flight from Sodom ſhe looked back. But how was this a Sin? Wherein conſiſted the ſinfulneſs of her ſo doing? What fault was it for a poor diſtreſſed Woman to look back upon the City where ſhe had dwelt, and where her Friends & Acquaintance were, and from whence ſhe was taking her final Departure? Might ſhe not without offence turn her Eyes upon Sodom as ſhe was eſcaping from it? Might ſhe not ſee it once more before it was utterly conſumed? Might ſhe not caſt an Eye of Pity towards, and Weep for her miſerable Neighbours in flames of Brimſtone?
HER looking back was ſinful,
1. BECAUSE it was contrary to a divine Prohibition.

SIN is a Tranſgreſſion of the Law. Lot's Wive's looking back on Sodom was the Tranſgreſſion of a particular Law, the breach of an expreſs Order given them, Gen. 19.17. It came to paſs when they had brought them forth abroad, that he ſaid, Eſcape for thy Life, look not behind thee. Lot's Wife, as well as he, was ſolemnly Charged not to look behind; ſo that ſhe did that which was expreſly and plainly forbidden her. And to act contrary to the leaſt Commandment, or Prohibition of the great GOD, is no ſmall offence, no petty fault. Lot's Wive's Diſobedience may be illuſtrated by that of Saul's, in ſparing the beſt of the Amalekites Sheep and Oxen for Sacrifice; This was very offenſive to GOD, becauſe contrary to an expreſs Order given him to ſlay them all: The Prophet thus ſet his Sin before him, 1 Sam. 15, 22, 23. Hath the Lord as great delight in burnt-offerings and ſacrifices, as in obeying the voice of the Lord? Behold, to obey is better than ſacrifice, and to hearken than the fat of Rams. For rebellion is as the 〈◊〉 of witchcraft, and ſtubbornneſs it is as iniquity and idolatry. Saul's rebellion in that matter, which was in it ſelf ſmall, was as really a Sin, & Provocation
of GOD'S Wrath as Witchcraft or Idolatry. It was a Contempt of the great Lawgiver's Authority. And ſo was Lot's Wive's looking back. Abraham the ſame Morning looked toward Sodom, and ſaw the ſmoke of it's Torments aſcending, Gen. 19.27, 28. This was no Sin in Abraham, for he was not forbidden to look toward Sodom: But it was a great Sin in Lot's Wife to look back upon it, for the Lord had ſaid to her, Look not behind thee.

THIS teacheth us, to meaſure Sin by the Commandment; and ſo it will appear exceeding ſinful. Perſons are ready to make light of many evil Actions, and to ſtroke them with a gentle Cenſure, becauſe they are not ſo groſs & crying as others. But the matter in which we Sin is not ſo much to be regarded, as the Authority which is thereby deſpiſed. What is in it ſelf ſmall & inconſiderable is a great offence, if the Lord hath forbidden it. The firſt Woman took of the fruit of a certain Tree in Eden, and eat it. Could ſo ſmall a thing as the eating an Apple be very offenſive to GOD? Yet the Lord God ſaid unto the Woman, What is this thou haſt done? Gen. 3.13. What an heinous Crime haſt thou committed? Becauſe GOD had expreſly ſaid, Of that Tree thou ſhalt not eat. GOD'S Authority is contemned, his Will reſiſted by our doing the leaſt thing which he hath forbidden; therefore no ſuch Act muſt be accounted by us a ſmall offence. We ſhould not ſay of it, as Lot did of Zoar, which he deſir'd might be ſpared to be the City of his Refuge, Is it not a little One? Sometimes the ſmaller the matter is in which we tranſgreſs, the greater is the Offence; as when the Prohibition of it is very plain & peremptory, the Temptation unto it ſlight, and it be a thing which might eaſily be left undone. Whatſoever we do contrary to the declared Will of GOD, is a horrid Indignity offer'd to his Majeſty & Authority: It is Rebellion, which in every caſe is as the Sin of Witchcraft and Idolatry.
2. IN Lot's Wive's looking back upon Sodom there was a Contempt of GOD's Omniſcience.

SHE not only deſpis'd the Authority & Commandment
of GOD, but alſo practically deny'd his Omniſcience: for it is ſaid, that ſhe locked back from behind Lot. She committed this Sin ſecretly. She was behind her Husband; and ſince his Eye was not upon her, ſhe ventur'd to look back; thereby expreſſing a Contempt of GOD'S all-ſeeing Eye. She was afraid that if righteous Lot ſaw her he wou'd be angry with her for diſobeying the Lord; but not afraid that a Righteous GOD would ſee her, and be diſpleaſed at her Sin. This is an aggravation of ſecret Sins, that the Omniſcience of GOD is eſpecially contemned thereby; as if the Eye of GOD was not to be ſo much regarded & reverenc'd as the Eye of Man.
3. LOT's Wive's looking back on Sodom proceeded from an evil Heart of Unbelief.

THE Angels which came to Lot's Houſe, told him, and his Wife, that ſwift Deſtruction was coming upon Sodom: Lot inform'd his Sons in-law of it, and ſaid unto them, Up, get ye out of this place, for the Lord will deſtroy this city: but he ſeemed unto them as one that mocked. Altho' his Wife did not reject the Warning with ſuch ſcorn, as they did, yet it ſeems, that ſhe queſtion'd the Truth of the Threatning, and therefore look'd back to ſee whether it would be Executed or not. It was ſaid to her, Look not behind thee, leſt thou be conſumed. But ſhe did not believe ſhe ſhou'd be conſumed for looking back. It is ſaid in the Book of the Wiſdom of Solomon, chap. 10. v. 7. That a ſtanding Pillar of Salt, is a Monument of an unbelieving Soul.—Not to believe GOD, is to make him a Liar: It is a great Sin, to doubt of his Veracity in his Menaces, as well as Promiſes. Such Unbelief is the Root of Diſobedience. Men deſpiſe the Commandments of GOD, becauſe they do not believe his Threatnings, Heb. 3.12. Take heed, Brethren, leſt there be in any of you an evil heart of unbelief, in departing from the living God.
4. THERE was the Luſt of the Eye in Lot's Wive's looking back upon Sodom.

"IT was a look of Covetouſneſs". Sodom was a rich and pleaſant place: It was even as the Garden of
the Lord, Gen. 13.10. Lot's Wife was very loth to go out of it; ſhe lingered in it, (as indeed Lot himſelf did) after ſhe was warned to flee; the Angels laid hold on her hand, and brought her forth, and ſet her without the City, plucking her as a Brand out of the Fire: and ſhe went not far from Sodom before her Love to her worldly accommodations there, made her look back, with uneaſy Deſires to return to it, there to enjoy the Wealth, Pleaſures & Friends which ſhe had left. So that her Sin was great: her Rebellion was as the Sin of Idolatry, for Covetouſneſs is Idolatry: It is loving and ſerving the Creature more than the Creator. We cannot obey GOD, ſo long as this Luſt remains unmortified: We may ſeem to hearken to his Call for a time, and to flee from Wrath; but if we love the World, and the things of it, we ſhall look, and draw back unto Perdition, 2 Tim. 4.10. Demas hath forſaken me, having loved this preſent World. We ſhould remember Lot's Wife, that we may take heed and beware of Covetouſneſs.
5. LOT's Wive's looking back on Sodom imply'd a Contempt of the Mercy of GOD in delivering her out of it.

WHEN the Lord was about to rain "Hell out of Heaven" upon Sodom, and the Neighbouring Cities, he ſent his Angels (and one of them was the bleſſed Angel of the Covenant, for he is ſtiled Jehovah, Gen. 19.24.) GOD ſent them to bring out Lot, and his Wife and Children, that they might not be conſumed in the Iniquity & Overthrow of Sodom. The Lord being merciful did this: Lot ſpake of it with Admiration, ſaying, Behold now, thy Servant hath found Grace in thy ſight, and thou haſt magnified thy mercy which thou haſt ſhewed unto me in ſaving my Life. But his Wife deſpiſed ſo great a Mercy; ſhe had low Thot's of it: ſhe did not accept the miraculous Deliverance with Thankfulneſs: ſhe was ſo unſuitably affected with the Kindneſs GOD had ſhown her in ſaving her Life, that ſhe look'd back on Sodom with a diſcontented Eye, becauſe ſhe was 〈◊〉 from her worldly Enjoyments there.
This vile Ingratitude made her Sin ſo heinous in GOD'S ſight. When Mercy is deſpiſed, Wrath is exaſperated: Sins committed after ſignal Deliverances, are exceedingly aggravated. Ezra 9.13, 14.— Seeing that thou our God haſt given us ſuch Deliverance as this, ſhould we again break thy Commandments? The gracious GOD hath ſent the chief of thoſe Angels which he ſent to Sodom, the glorious increated Angel, the Lord Jeſus Chriſt into the World, to deliver us from the everlaſting Burnings of Hell: Let us not imitate Lot's Wife in deſpiſing this great Mercy.
THUS we ſhould remember and improve the Sin of Lot's Wife.
II. WE ſhou'd remember the PUNISHMENT of Lot's Wife: the terrible Judgment which GOD inflicted upon her.

THIS is recorded for our Admonition, Gen. 19.26. She became a Pillar of Salt. When ſhe looked back, ſhe was ſtruck dead upon the ſpot, and was turned into a Pillar of Salt. By her becoming a Pillar of Salt, ſome I think, underſtand no more than her being made a laſting Monument of GOD'S ſevere Juſtice; as a perpetual Covenant is ſtiled a Covenant of Salt, Num. 18.19. But why the literal Senſe of the words ſhould be rejected, I can ſee no Reaſon; but do believe that ſhe was really turned into a Pillar, a Statue of Salt, a kind of rocky, mineral Salt, which will endure all Weathers and not waſte away. Naturaliſts write of Salt which is hard enough for Buildings.— Joſephus, who lived ſince Chriſt was on Earth, ſaith that the Pillar of Salt was ſtanding in his Time, and that He himſelf had ſeen it. And the like is affirmed by others ſince his time. — We are now call'd to look upon it with the Eyes of our Minds.
1. WE ſhou'd remember the Puniſhment of Lot's Wife, becauſe it repreſents to us the evil Nature, and infinite Demerit of Sin.

LOT's Wives Puniſhment was ſevere & dreadful, yet it did not exceed the deſert of her Crime, for looking back upon Sodom, ſhe was turned into a Pillar of Salt.—By this we may learn, That there is more Evil
in every Sin, than Men are aware of: It is more diſpleaſing to the holy GOD than we can imagine it to be: GOD'S Thot's of Sin are not as Man's; his account of it and Man's are very different. The Infinite Being againſt whom Sin is committed, and who only knows the Malignity & Demerit of it, does not make light of the ſmalleſt Sin. The Wages of every Sin is Death. And the righteous GOD, to ſhew his Hatred of Sin, and what a heavy Puniſhment it deſerves, ſometimes in this World remarkably executes Vengeance upon Men, for thoſe Faults, which to a common Eye appear ſmall & inconſiderable. He that turned Lot's Wife into a Pillar of Salt, for looking back on Sodom, ſtruck Uzzah dead, for touching the Ark; and ſmote the Men of Bethſhemeſh Fifty Thouſand, threeſcore and ten, for looking into it. Behold therefore the ſeverity of God: on them which fell ſeverity, Rom. 11.22.— Jer. 2.19. Know therefore and ſee, that it is an evil thing and bitter, that thou haſt forſaken the Lord thy God, and that my fear is not in thee, ſaith the Lord God of hoſts.— On the Pillar of Salt is engraven the Deſert & Doom of every Sinner amongſt us, and He that runs may read it. Lot's Wife is thus ſet forth for an Example, ſhewing to us what we deſerve for our Rebellion, Atheiſm, Unbelief, Covetouſneſs, and Contempt of GOD'S Mercy. Was Lot's Wife a greater Sinner than You, or I? They are not always the greateſt offenders, on whom GOD inflicts the moſt viſible Judgments in this World, See Luk. 13.1, 2, 3, &c. We ſhou'd look upon the Pillar of Salt, that our Fleſh may tremble for fear of GOD, and that we may be afraid of his Judgments. The Deſert of Sin is ſtill the ſame, and GOD is immutably and impartially Juſt; what he hath done to others, he may do to us. It is certain, that unleſs our Repentance prevent, GOD'S Wrath will fall upon us, if not in ſuch a manner, yet as terribly as it did upon Lot's Wife: and as it will be more tolerable for Sodom & Gomorrah, ſo it will for Lot's Wife in the Day of Judgment, than for us, if we continue to neglect & deſpiſe the great Mercy of GOD in ſending his
Angel, the Lord JESUS, to deliver us from the Lake that burns with Fire & Brimſtone.
2. WE ſhou'd remember the Puniſhment of Lot's Wife, and be convinced of the Folly and Danger of ſinning in Secret.

SHE looked back from behind Lot, ſo that he could not obſerve and reprove her; but ſhe was before GOD, did that Evil in His ſight, and He rebuk'd her in His Anger. GOD'S Judgments will ſooner or later find Men out in their moſt ſecret Sins, Zeph. 1.12. I will ſearch Jeruſalem with candles, and puniſh the men that are ſettled on their lees; that ſay in their heart, the Lord will not do good, neither will he do evil. There is no darkneſs, nor ſhadow of Death, in which the workers of Iniquity can hide themſelves from his Eyes, which are as a flame of Fire. If we are Religious & Pray in Secret, our gracious Father in Heaven will reward us openly: But if we are Wicked, and Sin in Secret, our righteous Judge will puniſh us openly; if not in this World, yet ſadly in that which is to come. Wo unto their Soul, who declare their Sin as Sodom, and hide it not: Wo alſo unto theirs, who conceal their Sin as Lot's Wife, for GOD will reveal it, and reckon with them for it.
3. WE ſhou'd remember Lot's Wive's Puniſhment, and not deſire, nor delight in the forbidden Society of vicious Perſons, leſt we be involved in their Ruin.

LOT's Wife lingered in, and look'd back upon Sodom, wiſhing (moſt probably) that ſhe might enjoy the Company of her Friends & Acquaintance there; and therefore ſhe ſuffer'd with them. GOD's exemplary Vengeance was poured down on her at the ſame time, that it was on them; and it is probable in the ſame manner. Fire & Brimſtone might be rained on her, as well as on them. A judicious Divine thus expounds that Text, Gen. 19.24. The Lord rained upon Sodom and upon Gomorrah, brimſtone & fire; that is, He conſumed them by Thunder & Lightning. Which (ſaith he) ſome of the Pagans had notice of, for Tacitus tells us, that thoſe Cities were ſet on fire and burnt up by the ſtroke of Thunder. He adds, The
Saline Pillar which Lot's Wife was turned into, was probably the Effect of this wonderful Meteor; for from ſeveral Examples it appears, that Perſons ſtruck with Thunder have continued in the ſame Poſture wherein they were when they were alive, and their dead Bodies are ſtiffned by the ſulphurious Vapours penetrating them. But whether Lot's Wife was ſtruck dead with a flaſh of that Fire which burned Sodom or not, yet ſhe was deſtroyed with that wicked People; and as Sodom was turned into a Lake, Heaps and Pits of Salt Gen. 14.3. Deut 29.23. Zeph. 2.9., ſo Lot's, Wife was turned into a Pillar of Salt. She partook of the ſame Curſe. This is a Warning to us, not to hanker after the forbidden Society of lewd & wicked Perſons, leſt we be deſtroyed with them. If we have fellowſhip with the unfruitful Works of Darkneſs, we ſhall be led forth with the Workers of Iniquity. If our Life be now among the Unclean, we may expect ſoon to have our part with them in the Lake which burneth with Fire & Brimſtone, Rev. 18.4. I heard another voice from Heaven, ſaying, Come out of her, my People, that ye be not partakers of her ſins, and that ye receive not of her plagues.
4. WE ſhou'd remember the Puniſhment of Lot's Wife, that ſudden Deſtruction from GOD may be a Terror to us.

WHEN Lot's Wife looked back, ſhe immediately became a Pillar of Salt: She was ſtruck dead in a moment. This inſtance of GOD'S Wrath ſhou'd make us ſenſible how obnoxious we are to ſudden Deſtruction. The Long-ſuffering of GOD waited upon Lot's Wife, while ſhe lingred in Sodom; but when ſhe looked back, his Wrath made quick work. GOD hath exercis'd great Patience toward us, yet he may bring ſwift Deſtruction upon us, Iſa. 42.13, 14. The Lord ſhall go forth as a mighty man, he ſhall ſtir up jealouſy like a man of war: he ſhall cry, yea, roar; he ſhall prevail againſt his Enemies. I have a long time held my peace, I have been ſtill & refrained my ſelf, now will
I cry like a travailing woman, I will deſtroy and devour at once. While we are in our Sins, we have no Security, no, not for one moment, from the deſtroying Judgments of GOD. Vengeance which hath been hitherto delayed, may overtake and ſurprize us in the next Act of Sin. If we proceed a ſtep further in an evil Courſe, our feet may ſtumble, and we fall head-long into Perdition. We ſhou'd remember Lot's Wife, and other Examples of ſudden Deſtruction, and ſtand on 〈◊〉 , and nor ſin. Let Unclean Perſons remember Zimri & Cozbi, on whom vengeance was executed in the very Act of their Uncleanneſs, Numb. 25.8. When any one is tempted to that wickedneſs, let him think of the Dart that ſtriketh thro' the Liver, Prov. 7.23. Let proud & arrogant Sinners remember Herod, whom the Angel of the Lord ſmote immediately, Acts 12.23. Let Riotous & Profane Perſons remember Belſhazzar, who was ſlain in that Night, when his Heart was merry with Wine, and no Veſſels but thoſe of the Sanctuary wou'd ſerve him for a drunken Frolick, Dan. 5. — Luk. 21.34. Take heed to your ſelves, leſt at any time your hearts be over-charged with ſurfeiting and drunkenneſs, and the cares of this Life, and ſo that day come upon you unawares. Let all careleſs, ſenſual and worldly Wretches remember the Sinners of the old World, and of Sodom, who gave up themſelves wholly to their ſecular Buſineſs and carnal Delights, till the Flood and the fiery Storm came and deſtroyed them all. Let us not put the evil Day far from us. "The Prophet gives us the Alarm like one that awakens a Family with the cry of Fire, Fire," Zeph. 1.14. The great day of the Lord is near, it is near, and haſteth greatly. Peals of Warning are now ſounded in our Ears both from the Word and the Providence of GOD, and if our ſtupid Hearts are not moved with fear, and we do not flee from Wrath, we may look for ſudden & inevitable Deſtruction, Prov. 29.1. He that being often reproved, hardneth his neck, ſhall ſuddenly be deſtroyed, and that without remedy.
5. WE ſhou'd remember the Judgment inflicted on Lot's Wife, and fear leſt we bring on our ſelves a ſtrange Puniſhment.

THIS was a ſtrange Puniſhment, a Woman turned into a Pillar of Salt. Not only the ſuddenneſs, but alſo the ſtrangeneſs of a Puniſhment is to be dreaded. The common Calamities of Mankind are apt to be look'd upon by too many, as the Effects of natural Cauſes only, or to be aſcrib'd to Fortune: GOD therefore ſometimes goes out of the beaten Road of his Judicial Diſpenſations, and inflicts ſome rare, extraordinary Judgment, to awaken the drowſy World to take notice of his Hand. Numb. 16.29, 30, 31. If theſe men die the common death of all men, or if they be viſited after the viſitation of all men, then the Lord hath not ſent me. But if the Lord make a new thing, and the Earth open her mouth, and ſwallow them up, with all that appertain unto them, and they go down quick into the Pit: then ye ſhall underſtand that theſe men have provoked the Lord. And it came to paſs as he had made an end of ſpeaking all theſe words, that the ground clave aſunder that was under them: and the Earth opened her mouth & ſwallowed them up. We ſhould fear and tremble, leſt GOD ſhould viſit us with ſome ſuch unuſual Judgment, Job 31.3. Is not deſtruction to the wicked? and a ſtrange puniſhment to the workers of iniquity? Deſtruction will certainly be their Portion, unleſs they Repent, and it may be brought upon them in ſome extraordinary and dreadful manner, Iſa. 28.21. The Lord ſhall riſe up as in mount Perazim, he ſhall be wroth as in the valley of Gibeon, that he may do his work, his ſtrange work; and bring to paſs his act his ſtrange act.
6. WE ſhou'd remember the Puniſhment of Lot's Wife, and be deterred from Sin by the Shame which is the Fruit of it.

IT was a diſgraceful Puniſhment that Lot's Wife ſuffered. The Pillar of Salt into which ſhe was turned was a laſting Memorial of her Sin & Folly, and perpetuates her Shame. Men always diſhonour GOD by ſinning againſt him; and ſometimes in puniſhing of
them in this World he ſets a mark of peculiar Infamy upon them, and cauſeth their Sins to be remembred to their Diſgrace in after-Ages. His Judgments inflicted upon them are monumental Pillars, on which their Sins are written to their great reproach and perpetual ſhame. Some Puniſhments are like Pillars of Salt, not to keep Sinners Names from ſtinking in the noſtrils of Poſterity, but to preſerve the Memory of them to their everlaſting Diſgrace. In ſome Executions of divine Juſtice, GOD doth, as it were hang up Malefactors in Chains, and make them "Spectacles of public Shame". Ezek. 5.14, 15. I will make thee a reproach among the Nations that are round about thee, in the ſight of all that paſs by. So it ſhall be a reproach and a taunt, an inſtruction and an aſtoniſhment unto the Nations that are round about thee, when I ſhall execute Judgments in thee in anger, and in fury, and in furious rebukes.
THUS in the Judgment inflicted on Lot's Wife, there is much Inſtruction & Warning given unto us. It may therefore be very profitable for us to remember her Puniſhment.
HAVING ſpoken thus diſtinctly, firſt, Of the Sin, and ſecondly, Of the Puniſhment of Lot's Wife, and ſhown how we ſhould remember & improve each of them,— I would under a third general Head,
III. CONSIDER them TOGETHER, and ſhow what the Inſtruction & Warning is, which they jointly afford us: and it is this, viz. That in our flight from myſtical Sodom, we ſhould not look back.

THIS is the chief & comprehenſive Benefit deſign'd us by the great Lover of our Souls, in calling upon us to remember Lot's Wife, namely, That we might be deter'd from looking back, when we are flying from Wrath. CHRIST ſaid to his Diſciples, In that Day (meaning the day of GOD'S vengeance againſt Jeruſalem) let not him that is in the field turn back. Remember Lot's Wife. As if he had ſaid, You muſt
flee out of Jeruſalem with all poſſible ſpeed, and beware leſt you imitate Lot's Wife, who as ſhe was eſcaping from Sodom looked back upon it, and for ſo doing was immediately turned into a Pillar of Salt. And what CHRIST ſaid to them is applicable, and is now directed to us all in this ſolemn Memento and Caution,
REMEMBER Lot's Wife, and in your flight from ſpiritual Sodom take heed that ye look not back, leſt ye alſo be Conſumed.
THAT this Admonition may be ſet in a clear Light before our Underſtandings, and come with power on our Hearts and Conſciences, and have a good Influence into our Behaviour, I wou'd obſerve to you,
I. THAT while Men are in the Corrupt State of Nature, they are myſtically in Sodom.

THEY are in ſuch a Condition as Sodom was an Emblem of. They are ſo both in reſpect of the groſs Pollution which they are wallowing in, and the dreadful Deſtruction which they are expoſed to. Sodom was a very polluted and dangerous Place; the State of Nature is ſuch a State: All that are in it, are in as deep Pollution and great Danger, as thoſe who dwelt in Sodom. — Let this two-fold Reſemblance betwixt Sodom and a State of Nature be conſider'd by us,
1. UNCONVERTED Sinners may be fitly ſaid to be in Sodom, in regard of that Pollution which they wallow in
SODOM was a Sink of moral Pollution, in which the People like Swine did wallow: and ſo it repreſented the Corrupt State of Nature, in which the Children of Men are altogether filthy.

IT is ſaid, Gen. 13.13. That the Men of Sodom were wicked, and ſinners before the Lord exceedingly. And this may be truly ſaid of all that are in the State of Nature: Tho' they are not all in reſpect of actual Sins, ſo wicked as the Men of Sodom were, yet they are in reſpect of the habitual 〈◊〉 and Perverſeneſs of their Nature. Original Sin is greater than all the
actual Abominations that were committed in Sodom. Sodom was a Sink, but corrupt Nature is a Fountain of moral Defilements: And there is more filthy Water in this Fountain, than ever iſſued forth in the impure ſtreams of Sodom. The Fountain did not caſt out all it's dirty Waters, even in that ſo defiled Land. Altho' that People did draw iniquity with cords of vanity and ſin as it were with a rope, yet they did not draw the Fountain dry. But as the Streams diſcover what the Fountain is, ſo the abominable Wickedneſs in Sodom, ſheweth to us what the Corruption of our fallen Nature is. And thoſe who are in the State of Polluted Nature, are in reſpect thereof more filthy & deſperately wicked, than the People of Sodom, were in reſpect of the actual Abominations which prevailed in it. They dwell amidſt greater Impurities, than thoſe which were viſible, and did openly abound in Sodom.

THERE is this remarkable difference between Sodom and a State of Nature; It was poſſible for a Man to be Righteous in the former, but it is not ſo in the latter. Indeed, there were not ten righteous Perſons to be found in Sodom, when the LORD came down to ſee whether the People had done altogether according to the Cry that went up to him; yet there was One good Man that lived in it at that time; Juſt Lot, vexed, and ſo not corrupted, with the filthy converſation of the wicked there: For that righteous man dwelling among them, in ſeeing and hearing, vexed his righteous ſoul from day to day with their unlawful deeds, 2 Pet. 2.7, 8. It was poſſible, tho' very difficult for one to live in Sodom, and not be infected with the Sins of that Place; but it is impoſſible for one to abide in the State of Nature, and to be free from the Pollutions of it, Job 15.14. What is man that he ſhould be clean? and he which is born of a woman, that he ſhould be righteous? It is impoſſible for him to be ſo, till he is born of GOD, and there be a Change of his Heart and State.

THUS in reſpect of original Corruption, and actual Abominations, Sinners, wherever they dwell on the face of the Earth, are the people of Sodom. In a ſpiritual ſenſe they live in Sodom. GOD may juſtly ſay concerning all who are in the State of polluted Nature, as in Jer. 23.14. They are all of them unto me as Sodom, and the Inhabitants thereof as Gomorrah.
2. ALL unconverted Sinners may be fitly ſaid to be in Sodom, in reſpect of that Deſtruction to which, they are expos'd.

THE State of Nature is like Sodom, not only in regard of the Pollution but alſo of the Puniſhment of thoſe who continue in it. GOD'S exemplary Vengeance on Sodom is mentioned in our Context, ver. 29. The ſame day that Lot went out of Sodom, it rained fire and brimſtone from Heaven, and deſtroyed them all. Agreable to the Account given of it, Gen. 19. 24, 25. The Lord rained upon Sodom and upon Gomorrah, brimſtone and fire from the Lord out of Heaven. And he overthrew thoſe cities, and all the plain, and all the inhabitants of the cities. Now this was Emblematical of the utter Deſtruction of all thoſe who finally remain in the State of Nature; ſo the Scriptures inform us, 2 Pet. 2.6. Turning the cities of Sodom and Gomorrah into aſhes, condemned them with an overthrow, making them an enſample unto thoſe that after ſhould live ungodly. The Ruin of the People of Sodom ſheweth to all who live ungodly, what they muſt expect, and what their End will certainly be, if they remain in a State of Nature, viz. to be burned. The Fire which conſumed the Inhabitants of Sodom, was a Type of Hell-fire, which ſhall conſume all the Adverſaries of GOD, Jude v. 7. Even as Sodom and Gomorrah, and the cities about them in like manner
giving themſelves over to fornication, and going after ſtrange fleſh are ſet forth as an example, ſuffering the vengeance of eternal fire. The Fire which deſtroyed them is ſaid to be Eternal, either becauſe of the ſtill continuing Effects of it, or rather, becauſe it was a Type or Repreſentation of the Fire of Hell, and to thoſe miſerable Sodomites the very beginning of it, they being brought by thoſe temporal Flames into everlaſting Burnings Pool's Annot.. The terrible Deſtruction of the Sinners in Sodom, by Fire and Brimſtone, was a lively Repreſentation of the ſad and eternal Ruin of all impenitent Sinners. Upon the wicked God ſhall rain ſnares, fire and brimſtone, and an horrible tempeſt: this ſhall be the portion 'of their cup. The Heavens and the Earth which are now, by the ſame Word which created them, are kept in ſtore, reſerved unto fire, againſt the day of Judgment, and perdition of ungodly men. — Then ſhall the King, the righteous Judge, ſay unto them on the left hand, Depart from me, ye Curſed, into everlaſting fire. And they ſhall be caſt into a lake of fire, burning with brimſtone. Thus, as the Inhabitants of Sodom were all deſtroyed by Fire and Brimſtone, ſo the Scriptures ſpeak of the final Deſtruction of all impenitent Sinners, as that which ſhall be by Fire & Brimſtone, whether properly or metaphorically, I ſhall not diſpute: But only ſay, that if we take theſe Scriptures in a figurative ſenſe, they repreſent the Pains of the Damned to be at leaſt as exquiſite & intolerable, as thoſe which Fire and Brimſtone can produce. How did the poor tormented Wretches in Sodom run ſcreaming about, when ſhowers of flaming Brimſtone came down upon them, and their Bodies were ſo many blazing Torches! Alas, How then will miſerable Sinners roar out, gnaſh their Teeth, and gnaw their Tongues for Pain and Anguiſh, when they ſhall be thrown into the Lake that burns with Fire and Brimſtone, which is the ſecond Death, far worſe than the firſt! — Now let Sinners in Zion (who are alſo
in ſpiritual Sodom) be afraid, let 〈◊〉 take hold on Hypocrites; for who among 〈◊〉 ſhall dwell with the devouring Fire? Who amongſt us ſhall dwell with everlaſting Burnings?
THUS we ſee in what reſpects the State of Nature may be ſpiritually called Sodom.
Obſ. II. THAT the Children of Men are warned to Flee out of ſpiritual Sodom.

LOT's Wife, and others in Sodom, were fore-warned of the burning Tempeſt which GOD would rain upon it, and were compaſſionately advis'd & urg'd to get out of Sodom, that they might not be involv'd in it's overthrow. GOD ſent Angels from Heaven, to give them notice of the approaching Ruin: yea, the Meſſenger of the Covenant was ſent on this Errand. Thoſe Miniſters of GOD called upon Lot, his Wife and Daughters, to make haſte, and get out of the accurſed City; And while they lingered in Sodom, being; loth to leave their commodious Dwelling, rich Eſtate, and worldly Conveniencies, the Angels laid hold on their hands, and brought them forth, and ſet them without the City and charged them to eſcape for their Lives, and not to ſtay in all the Plain, but to eſcape to the Mountain, Gen. 19. In like manner the gracious GOD deals with the Children of Men, who are in ſpiritual Sodom. He warns them to get out of the polluted, dangerous Eſtate of Nature: He ſends his Miniſters, the Angels of the Churches, who cry aloud, and ſhew unto Sinners their Danger, Duty and Intereſt; calling earneſtly upon them to forſake their Sins, and part with all which is inconſiſtent with the Safety and Salvation of their Souls: yea, the glorious increated Angel doth by the Miniſtry of the Word come, and warn Sinners to eſcape out of myſtical Sodom. 2 Cor. 5.20. Now then we are Ambaſſadors for Chriſt, as though God did beſeech you by us: we pray you in Chriſt's ſtead, Be ye reconciled to God▪ — By awakning Diſpenſations of his Providence, and ſtrong Convictions of his Spirit, the LORD doth, as it were, lay hold on the hands of lingring Sinners,
and pull them out of Sodom; making them leave off the practice of their groſs Abominations, and to uſe ſome Endeavours to reform their Lives, and ſave their Soul.— Thus graciouſly is the Long-ſuffering GOD pleas'd to warn thoſe who are in ſpiritual Sodom, to haſten out of it, and flee to the City of Refuge, which he hath appointed and prepared for them, leſt they be conſumed with his fiery Indignation, which he will pour out on all who remain in the corrupt and accurſed State of Nature. Matth. 3.7. O Generation of vipers, who hath 〈◊〉 you to flee from the wrath to come?— When the GOD of Hoſts is coming forth in his Judgments againſt his Enemies, he obſerves that Law of Arms which he gave the Iſraelites; which was, to offer Terms of Peace to a City before they aſſaulted it, Deut. 20.10. When thou comeſt nigh unto a city to fight againſt it, then proclaim peace unto it. So the LORD, who is a Man of War, ſounds a Parly with the Trumpet of his Word, and monitory Providences, before he diſchargeth the Cannons of his deſtroying Judgments: He Summons his Enemies to a Treaty of Peace, [Prepare to meet thy God O Iſrael] before he falls on them with the Artillery of his Vengeance. He gives Notice to Sinners of their approaching Ruin, that ſo by their Repentance they might prevent it, Jer. 18.11. Thus ſaith the Lord, Behold, I frame evil againſt you, and deviſe a device againſt you: return ye now every one from his evil way, and make your ways, and your doings good — Hear now the word of the Lord, ye men of Sodom; Give ear, Ye people of Gomorrah, all that are in the polluted dangerous Eſtate of Nature: — Waſh ye, make you clean, put away the evil of your doings from before mine eyes, ceaſe to do evil, learn to do well— Come now and let us reaſon together, ſaith the Lord: Tho' your ſins be as ſcarlet, they ſhall be as white as ſnow; tho' they be red like crimſon, they ſhall be as wool. If ye be willing and obedient, ye ſhall eat the good of the land: But if ye refuſe and rebel, ye ſhall be devoured — O Earth, Earth, Earth, hear the word of the Lord: O •••• leſs, ſtupid Sinners,
who mind earthly things, ye are again and again warned and intreated, to get out of ſpiritual Sodom, leſt Fire and Brimſtone be rained upon you. Zech. 2.6. Ho, ho, come forth, and flee from the land of the North, ſaith the Lord. Ye are now earneſtly called upon, to come forth, and flee from the Land of the South, as well as from the Land of the North — from myſtical Sodom, as well as Babylon. Will you ſtill linger, when the Clouds of GOD'S Diſpleaſure are viſibly hanging over our Heads, ready to burſt with Thunder and Lightning; and the Earth under us is ſenſibly heaving to vomit out Fire and Brimſtone, to conſume us? O Sinners, make haſte, delay no longer to get out of the State of Nature, and to keep GOD'S Commandments.—Eſcape for your Lives, — the Lives of your precious Souls.— Eſcape to the Mountain, the Mountain of the LORD'S Houſe:— Flee to CHRIST for Refuge.— Flee as Men purſued with the greateſt Danger.— Flee with all poſſible ſpeed — Yea, Flee like as they fled from before the Earthquake, in the days of Uzziah King of Judah.
LET me not ſeem to any of you, as Lot did to his Sons in Law, even as one that mocked.
Obſ. III. THAT in their flight from ſpiritual Sodom, Perſons are apt to look back.

LOT's Wife was brought without the City, and ſhe fled with him and her Daughters a while toward Zoar, and was in a fair way to eſcape the Ruin, which was then coming on the People of Sodom; But ſhe ſlacken'd her Pace, linger'd behind, and looked back. This Sin of Lot's Wife is imitated by many in their flight from ſpiritual Sodom: They are ſo far awaken'd and wro't upon, that they abandon their vicious Practices, and ſeem to be brought out of the State of polluted Nature; they turn their backs upon Sodom, and ſet their faces towards Zion, and are in a fair way to eſcape the wrath of GOD: they run well for a time; take conſiderable Pains in Religion, ſtrive to enter in at the ſtrait Gate of Repentance & Faith, labour to get
into CHRIST: perform holy Duties with much ſeriouſneſs, and apply themſelves to the Work of their Salvation with fear and trembling; and they are not far from the Kingdom of GOD: But they do not hold on, their Heat is ſoon ſpent, and they flag: Their dread of GOD'S Wrath, and concern for their Souls abate; good Impreſſions wear off; and they meeting with Difficulties in the way of Salvation, grow weary of the Chriſtian Race, ſtand ſtill, and look back —. They are tempted to think, there is no need of ſo much Care about their Souls, that they were in no ſuch Danger as they apprehended them to be; that the Fire & Brimſtone which they were told of, and affrighted with, will not be rained upon them: The Love of the World and the things of it, revives in them; and they fancy it was never better with them, than when they were quiet and undiſturb'd in the Enjoyment of their outward Comforts, and ſenſual Delights; and ſo thro' Unbelief, and Love of this World, they (as Lot's Wife did) look back with Deſires of returning to their former Pleaſures. The State of ſpiritual Pollution and Bondage appears not ſo bad to them, as when they were firſt awaken'd to get out of it; nay, better than that of Holineſs, which they have been ſtriving to get into: As the Iſraelites, in their Journey to Canaan, thought that it was better with them in Egypt, and ſaid one to another; let us make us a captain, and let us return into Egypt, Numb. 14.4. — They who ſeem to have eſcaped out of ſpiritual Sodom, and to have made conſiderable Progreſs toward Zion, do not ordinarily go back at once, but by degrees. They firſt look back; they grow weary of Prayer, and other Duties, are leſs frequent and fervent therein: They ſay, Behold, what a wearineſs is it? and they bring the torn, the lame and ſick for an offering to the Lord; Their Minds hanker after their former Company and Delights: Temptations increaſe upon them daily, and they are more and more inclin'd to reſume their abandon'd Luſts, and to renew their fellowſhip with the unfruitful Works of darkneſs. Having thus looked back, they
commonly (unleſs prevented by ſudden Deſtruction) go back to Sodom; revert to their old Abominations. Prov. 26.11. As a Dog returneth to his vomit, ſo a Fool returneth to his folly. This is cited by the Apoſtle, and apply'd to the Apoſtates in his time, [O that it were not verified in many of us!] 2 Pet. 2.22. It is happened unto them according to the true Proverb, The Dog is turned to his own vomit, and the Sow that was waſhed to her wallowing in the mire.
Obſ. IV. AWAKNED Sinners, in their flight from ſpiritual Sodom, ſhould remember Lot's Wife, that ſo they may be deter'd from looking back.

PERSONS may imitate the Sin, and incur the Puniſhment of Lot's Wife, tho' they do not attempt an Eſcape out of myſtical Sodom: may be guilty of Diſobedience, Contempt of GOD'S All-ſeeing Eye, of Unbelief, Covetouſneſs and Ingratitude for the Mercy of GOD in offering to ſave them from the flames of Hell; and thereby may expoſe themſelves to ſudden and ſhameful Deſtruction: But ſuch as have begun their flight from ſpiritual Sodom, (as I hope, ſome here preſent have,) if they look back, they eſpecially do imitate Lot's Wives Sin, and may expect as terrible a Puniſhment as Her's: It is therefore peculiarly ſeaſonable, and may be very profitable for thoſe who are endeavouring to get out of ſpiritual Sodom, are ſollicitouſly asking the way to Zion, with their faces thitherwards, and are flying from Wrath to come, to remember Lot's Wife. Look not behind you, leſt ye be conſumed— Will it not be as great a Sin in you, to look back, as it was in Lot's Wife? And may you not well be afraid of as great a Judgment, as that inflicted on her? If you look back, ye may become Pillars of Salt, Monuments of GOD'S ſevere Juſtice, Spectacles of Shame and everlaſting Reproach. If GOD doth not immediately conſume you, he may righteouſly ſmite you with Judicial Hardneſs; ſeal you up to Ruin by final Obduration, letting you ſtand a few Years more in this World, only as occaſions to glorify his Power & Wrath
upon you in the next. Theophilact ſaith, Lot's Wife remain'd obſtinate and impenitent, and her Heatt was hardned, and that this is the meaning of her being turned into a Pillar of Salt: Altho' his Interpretation of the Text is not to be embrac'd, yet it may be improv'd by thoſe who are in their flight from ſpiritual Sodom, to deter them from looking back, leſt in his ſenſe they become Pillars of hardned Salt.

Zeph. 1.6. I will ſtretch out my hand, and cut off them that are turned back. In the days of Joſiah, wherein this Threatning was denounced, the ſinful People of Judah were greatly awaken'd, & outwardly Reformed: But they ſoon revolted: Many that began well, ſet out with Zeal in the good ways of the Lord, turned and looked back: GOD threatned them particularly, that he would ſtretch out his hand, and cut them off, wou'd be quick and ſevere upon them. — Remember the words of CHRIST, Luk. 9.62. No man having put his hand to the plough, and looking back, is fit for the Kingdom of God. Go through with the work that ye have begun, or ye ſhall never enter into the Kingdom of God. Oh! Conſider the Danger and Miſchief of looking back. If ye return to your former Abominations, the unclean Spirit will have a ſtronger Poſſeſſion of you, than he had before, Matth. 12.43, 44, 45. When the unclean Spirit is gone out of a man, he walketh thro' dry places, ſeeking reſt, and findeth none. Then he ſaith, I will return into my houſe from whence I came out, and when he is come, he findeth it empty, ſwept, and garniſhed. Then goeth he, and taketh with himſelf ſeven other Spirits more wicked than himſelf, and they enter in and dwell there: and the laſt State of that man is worſe than the firſt. This is well Expounded by the Apoſtle, 2 Pet. 2.20, 21. For if after they have eſcaped the pollutions of the world, thro' the knowledge of the Lord and Saviour Jeſus Chriſt, they are again intangled therein, and overcome; the latter end is worſe with them than the beginning. For it had been better for them not to have known the way of Righteouſneſs,
than after they have known it, to turn from the holy Commandment delivered unto them.

IF ye ſhould be intangled again in your Luſts, and return to the Mire of your Sinful Pollutions, your Eſcape, if ever it be attempted by you, will be far more difficult than it was at firſt; your Deliverance out of Spiritual Sodom, will be almoſt deſpaired of.— Ye having begun in the Spirit, be not ſo fooliſh as to end in the fleſh. — If any of you have ſlacken'd your pace, and are turning and drawing back, be convinc'd of your folly and danger, and quickned in your flight to CHRIST, by what ye now hear, — Gal. 5.7. Ye did run well, who did hinder you, that you ſhould not obey the truth? — Renew your Reſolutions againſt Sin, and for Holineſs and Heaven: Lay aſide every weight, and the Sin that doth ſo eaſily beſet you, and run with patience and perſeverence the Race ſet before you: — and as ye run, Remember Lot's Wife.

LET ſuch as are really brought forth out of ſpiritual Sodom, and have fled for Refuge to lay hold on the Hope ſet before them, Remember Lot's Wife, to deter them alſo from looking back. Indeed, thoſe who are eſcaped out of myſtical Sodom, ought to look back thereon, with an admiring Eye at the infinite Mercy of GOD, in plucking them as Brands out of the Fire. They ſhou'd reflect on their former polluted and miſerable Eſtate, to excite their Thankfulneſs unto GOD for delivering them out of it; laying hold on their hearts by his omnipotent Grace, when they lingred in ſpiritual Sodom, and effectually bringing them out of it. There is a looking back, which may ſerve to abaſe them, and exalt divine Grace, Iſai. 51.1. Hearken to me, ye that follow after Righteouſneſs, ye that ſeek the Lord: look unto the Rock whence ye are hewen, and to the hole of the pit whence ye are digged. But they muſt not
look back on ſpiritual Sodom with any Regret for their leaving it, nor deſire of returning to it. — They are not, it's true, of them who draw back unto Perdition, Heb. 10.39. GOD'S electing Love, Covenant-faithfulneſs, almighty Power, and CHRIST'S continual Interceſſion ſhall prevent the total Defection of the Saints. But they are prone to look back, and to go back alſo a conſiderable way toward Sodom. Declenſions are very common among the ſincere People of GOD. They frequently ſlacken their Pace in the good ways of the LORD; grow Cold in Religion, remiſs in holy Duties, do abate much of their Zeal for GOD, and back-ſlide into many Sins. Altho' they ſhall not draw back unto eternal Perdition; yet they may to their ſpiritual Loſs, and temporal Deſtruction: They may provoke GOD to inflict ſuch Judgments on them, as to make them Monuments of his righteous diſpleaſure againſt the Sin of looking back. Dr. Edwards ſaith, Theol. ref. v. 1. p. 257. That it is not improbable that Lot's Wife, who was turn'd into a Pillar of Salt, was ſaved notwithſtanding this Judgment ſent upon her by GOD. We have (ſaith he) no ill Character of this Woman in the Scripture: [he might as truly have ſaid, that we have no good one:] we cannot (ſaith he) gather from any thing that is ſaid in the ſacred Hiſtory that ſhe had been a wicked Perſon: [neither can we that ſhe had been a righteous Perſon:] But this we know, ſaith he, that ſhe was the Conſort of a pious Saint, and beloved of GOD: [we alſo know that a wicked Woman is ſometimes the Wife of a godly Man:] And we know, ſaith he, that ſhe was mercifully deliver'd out of Sodom, as well as her Husband: [ſo might Lot's Sons in Law have been, had they not laugh'd at the warning given them.] Tho' I perceive not the ſtrength of thoſe Reaſons which the Doctor gives, why it is not improbable that Lot's Wife was a good Woman, yet I am diſpos'd to be of the moſt Charitable Opinion, if there are as probable Grounds to ſupport it as the
contrary. And if ſhe was a good Woman, the Puniſhment inflicted on her may the more deter the Saints from looking back: for it ſheweth how the Jealous GOD reſents this Sin in his own Children.— Let them remember Lot's Wife, and not imitate her Sin, but Paul's Example; Phil. 3.13, 14. Brethren, I count not my ſelf to have apprehended, but this one thing I do, forgetting thoſe things which are behind, and reaching forth unto thoſe things which are before; I preſs toward the mark, for the Prize of the high calling of God in Chriſt Jeſus. — Let them remember Lot's Wife, that ſo they may reſiſt and vanquiſh all Temptations to Apoſtacy: and if they do ſo, they ſhall become glorious Pillars in the heavenly Temple, bearing the moſt honourable Inſcription; Rev. 3.12, 13. Him that overcometh, will I make a Pillar in the Temple of my God, and he ſhall go no more out: and I will write upon him the Name of my God, and the Name of the City of my God, which is new Jeruſalem, which cometh down out of Heaven from my God; and I will write upon him my new Name.
HE THAT HATH AN EAR, LET HIM HEAR WHAT THE SPIRIT SAITH UNTO THE CHURCHES.

THUS I thought it meet to ſtir you up, by putting you in Remembrance of Lot's Wife. And if you are Careful to improve what hath been ſaid, You ſhall find that that Pillar of Salt hath not to this day loſt it's Savour; but that your Hearts are ſeaſoned thereby with ſuch Caution, and holy fear, as will be of unſpeakable & eternal Advantage to you: Wherefore, Be not forgetful Hearers, but Remember Lot's Wife.
